messages.subject: Re: [nihontostudy] tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 7/12/2005 11:29:10 P.M. Central Daylight Time, junkmail@toryu-mon.com writes: Rich- the plant leaves I believe are sasa, a kind of bamboo,
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 7/12/2005 11:29:10 P.M. Central Daylight Time,
junkmail@... writes:

Rich-
the plant leaves I believe are sasa, a kind of bamboo, the quarter
circles are a common element not sure if they ever had a "meaning."
-t

There once was a Japanese Miner
who took all his silver to China,
"these fellas must be nuts,
because all their ingots
look like an Aussie vagina!!"




-t,
Is that supposed to be haiku ? what ? it doesn't rhyme

-M


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: tsuba
messages.msgSnippet: please klick.............. http://tinyurl.com/6fgsn note the similarities of the two tsuba except the shape. Both shakudo. One from Christie s Compton
messages.messageBody:
please klick..............

http://tinyurl.com/6fgsn

note the similarities of the two tsuba except the shape.
Both shakudo.
One from Christie's Compton collection part 1.
The other is mine.
Can we assume they were made by the same guy ? or at least same
school ?

milt
